items.longDescription:
Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed)

After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes from the original manga and art from the TV anime, is available only at UNIQLO.

©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan

Logo created for the business card and letterhead of Anthony Hyde, a photographer who worked at that time rented desk space at Herb Lubalin's studio. The design combines Hyde's agent Li-Lian Oh and Anthony Hyde's name (initials).

Legends of Graphics

This collection focuses on the roots of logos and typography, featuring legendary corporate logos and works by two American graphic designers. Enjoy the sophisticated designs of Paul Rand, a master of "logo design," and Herb Lubalin, a pioneer of "typography".

Herb Lubalin
Renowned American graphic designer and typographer fascinated by the look and sound of words. He pioneered conceptual typography which he called "Graphic Expressionism," and created expressive "Word Pictures."

©️Herb Lubalin

Legends of Graphics

HYPEBEAST COMMUNITY CENTER

Hypebeast is a global media platform that focuses on the progression of culture. Four Hypebeast collaborators have come together to curate its own community club, with its unique concept incorporated into the apparel designs. The collection features graphics that are made exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

FaZe Clan
FaZe Clan is a digital-native lifestyle and media platform rooted in gaming and youth culture, reimagining traditional entertainment for the next generation. Founded in 2010 by a group of kids on the internet, FaZe Clan was created for and by Gen Z and Millennials, and today operates across multiple verticals. FaZe Clan’s roster of more than 100 influential personalities consists of engaging content creators, esports professionals, world-class gamers and a mix of talent who go beyond the world of gaming.

©Faze Clan. All rights reserved

One-point embroidery in neon colors and back prints evoke the 80’s and 90’s. A simple design with a pop edge.

Mickey Mouse x Keith Haring

Pay tribute to two artistic greats with this special design featuring Mickey Mouse and Keith Haring's iconic characters. Drawing inspiration from Disney's "how-to-draw" book, Haring's love of art and cartoons shines through in his distinctive style. This collection also includes a trendy, oversized T-shirt silhouette. Celebrate the intersection of two creative worlds with this must-have design.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Mickey Mouse character:TM & ©Disney.
Keith Haring artwork:© Keith Haring Foundation.

UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat

“UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

Mikasa, Armin, and Levi head to their final battle against Eren to stop the Rumbling. The design features an iconic scene in which Levi replies to Mikasa's words, "I'll do it, everyone cover me," as she resolves to kill her loved one. The scene from this epic battle is printed vibrantly on the back, while the "Wings of Freedom," the emblem that represents Survey Corps' freedom, is featured on the front of the T-shirt.

Attack on titan

The popular manga series written and illustrated by Hajime Isayama was serialized in “Bessatsu Shonen Magazine” from 2009 to 2021, the cumulative circulation has exceeded 110 million copies worldwide, and it continues to create shock waves not only in Japan but also around the world. These UT are inspired by this manga which captures the reader’s attention with a world where humanity is forced to live in cities surrounded by enormous “walls” that protect them from gigantic man-eating humanoids referred to as Titans, and “Vertical maneuvering equipment” developed to combat the Titans.

©Hajime Isayama / Kodansha Ltd.

Chainsaw Man × Kosuke Kawamura

Chainsaw Man is a TV anime series produced by MAPPA. The story follows a young devil hunter named Denji who makes a contract with Chainsaw Devil and is reincarnated as “Chainsaw Man.” The anime has received a lot of attention and positive feedback since its release. This time, we have collaborated with collage artist Kosuke Kawamura to recreate the world of the series in a bond and meticulous way. Enjoy this special collection that brings the world of Chainsaw Man to life.

Kosuke Kawamura

PIXAR ART

Pixar Animation Studios has created such beloved films as “Toy Story” and “Monsters, Inc.,” which continue to be loved by people all over the world. UNIQLO has invited artists who love Pixar films to reinterpret the famous characters in their own distinct style.

Adam Lister
Adam Lister lives and works in Beacon, New York. Lister is a visual artist whose work consists of geometric interpretations of iconic imagery and pop culture references. Lister breaks down classic images to their most elemental forms by combining the deconstructed and minimal aesthetic of pixelated graphics with the transparency of watercolor paint and the flatness of acrylic paint.

©Disney/Pixar
©Disney

items.longDescription:
- Hybrid down outerwear developed in collaboration with professional snowboarder, Ayumu Hirano.
- A combination of lightweight high-performance cotton padding with Heat of Absorption technology, and premium down with a fill power of 750* or more. *Measured by the IDFB method
- High-performance padding around the arms and hem creates a sleek silhouette and maintains warmth.
- Crisp outer fabric.
- Water-repellent finish. *The fabric is coated with a water-repellent agent so the effect lasts longer. The finish is not permanent.
- Collar stands up neatly without the hood up.
- Practical design with outer chest and waist pockets, handwarmers, and inner chest and waist pockets for plenty of storage.
- Non-quilted design on the outside for a sleek look.
- Streamlined design around the arms allows easy movement.
- Breathable mesh and ventilation holes keep you comfortable.
- Cuffs with hook-and-loop fastener allow easy adjustment.
- Suitable for everyday or outdoor wear.
items.name: Hybrid Down Parka
items.shortDescription: A precise combination of high-performance padding and premium down. Jointly developed with professional snowboarder Ayumu Hirano.
items.washingInformation: Hand wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Do not tumble dry.

items.longDescription:
- The unmistakable feel of 100% cashmere.
- High knitting tension produces a more luxurious texture. Hand-washable with anti-pilling processing.
- The body, shoulder, and sleeve widths have been adjusted to suit the thicker knit fabric.
- Collar pairs well with shirts and T-shirts.
- A versatile sweater with a natural glossy sheen and moderate drape.
items.name: Cashmere Crew Neck Long Sleeve Sweater
items.shortDescription: The unmistakable feel of 100% cashmere. Now with an even more luxurious texture.
